title: Spondyloepiphyseal Dysplasia Congenita: Epidemiology and Prevalence
short_description: Clinical document detailing the epidemiological characteristics and prevalence rates of spondyloepiphyseal dysplasia congenita.
long_description: This clinical research document provides epidemiological data on spondyloepiphyseal dysplasia congenita, a rare skeletal dysplasia. The document presents key statistical information including equal gender distribution, estimated incidence rates of approximately 1 in 100,000 live births, and contextualizes this condition within the broader category of skeletal dysplasias which collectively affect about 1 in 5,000 individuals in the general population. This information is valuable for understanding the rarity and demographic impact of this congenital skeletal disorder.
